channel.title: Code blocks on FOL
channel.description: Recent content in Code blocks on FOL

item.title: Blocks
item.description: Statements The actions that a program takes are expressed in statements. Common actions include declaring variables, assigning values, calling subprograms, looping through collections, and branching to one or another block of code, depending on a given condition. The order in which statements are executed in a program is called the flow of control or flow of execution. The flow of control may vary every time that a program is run, depending on how the program reacts to input that it receives at run time.
